projects.name: Home Page
projects.desc: INCEPTION! I made this to organize all of my projects, and have a way to access them when I'm not locally on my computer.

projects.name: Word Finder
projects.desc: I made this as a cheat for a mobile game called Word Cookies. In the game, you get a bunch of letters and have to make words of different lengths using those letters.

projects.name: Space Escape
projects.desc: This was made for my 7th grade Shark Tank ELA project. First, since I was bored after the test I made the game on a piece of paper, but with my group, we came up with this idea for the game. I programmed it during school, and Noah and Dominic did the music and some graphics.

projects.name: Wrote on Piece of paper
projects.desc: This is a game that I wrote on a piece of paper, after a 7th grade end of grade test. Later, I copied the code onto my computer, and after a little while of fixing some bugs, I had it working. You move up and down with your mouse, and avoid the red rectangles coming at you.

projects.name: Pixelvasion
projects.desc: This is a game I made (and won) for the itch.io Pixel Jam (https://itch.io/jam/pixel-jam). In this game, you are defending the earth from an army of pixel monsters, who are trying to pixelate the world.

projects.name: Harris B-day
projects.desc: Instead of making a birthday card for my brother, I programmed this. He watches a twitch streamer called phonecats, and this is his sub music, he also really wants a cat.

projects.name: Pong+
projects.desc: Pong+ is a  2 player game where one is shooting the pong balls, and the other has to avoid them. You when the other player gets hit. First to five wins!

projects.name: ShapesGame+
projects.desc: ShapesGame+ is an updated version of ShapesGame. Your player (white circle) will follow the mouse, and you have collect the dots to grow, get faster and gain score. You have to avoid the red squares being shot at you from the center. This version uses vectors, rotation

projects.name: Turrets
projects.desc: This is an unfinished game. You move towards your mouse, and click to shoot. There are turrets that shoot at you, but there is no collision detection so nothing happens when you or the turrets get hit. Althuough it isn't really playable and broken, I was able to reuse a lot of the code for other projects.

projects.name: Maze
projects.desc: In this game, you have to solve a randomly generated maze within the time limit. Credit to Daniel Shiffman for the maze generation algorithm and code. Each level, the maze gets more and more difficult.

projects.name: ShapesGame
projects.desc: ShapesGame is one of my first games, where you have to collect dots and avoid squares. Since it's one of my first games, it doesn't use vectors so you can move faster by going diagonally.

projects.name: Coloring
projects.desc: My very first p5js program! Altough I did do some java before this, I consider this my first programming project, because this was the first time I really started to understand what I was doing. Thanks to Daniel Shiffman for teaching me 99% of what I know.

projects.name: Really old Java
projects.link: javascript:(function(){   alert('Sorry, but you cant run this project on the web. You will have to download and run them through command line.');   })()
projects.desc: Before p5js, I watched the New Bostons java tutorials. I didn't completely understand what I was doing, but I still made some stuff.

projects.name: Minecraft Skript
projects.link: javascript:(function(){   alert('Sorry, but you cant run this project on the web.');   })()
projects.desc: When I had my Minecraft server, since I didn't know Java, I used a plugin called Skript to program. It's a lot like python and helped me learn the very basics of programming.
